monster.name: Baltigan Sand Spider
languages: Understands Garo but does not speak it

trait.name: Sand Stealth
entries: The sand spider gains an additional +3 to Stealth (+9 in total) in sand terrain.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The sand spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The sand spider has advantage on attack rolls against surprised targets.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sand spider makes two attacks with its impaling legs and one bite attack.

action.name: Impaling Leg
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage. If the sand spider scores a critical hit with this attack, it rolls damage dice three times instead of twice. If both impaling leg attacks hit the same target, the second hit deals an extra 11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage, or half as much poison damage with a successful {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw.

reaction.name: Trapdoor Ambush
entries: When a creature walks over a sand spider's hidden burrow, the spider can use its reaction to attack that creature with two impaling leg attacks. The creature is considered a surprised target for both attacks if they did not notice the burrow. If either attack hits and the target is a Medium or smaller creature, then the sand spider and the target engage in a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) contest. If the creature wins, it can immediately move 5 feet away from the sand spider. If the contest results in a tie, the creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). If the sand spider wins, the creature is grappled and dragged by the sand spider 30 feet into its lair. If the creature is still grappled at the start of the sand spider's next turn, it becomes {@condition restrained} instead. The restrained creature can escape by using an action to make a successful {@dc 15} Strength (Athletics) check.

monster.name: Jahad, The Sword Spirit

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: Jahad can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when he is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Alert
entries: Jahad has a +5 bonus to initiative. He can't be surprised while he is conscious. Other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against him as a result of being unseen by him.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: Jahad can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. He takes 1d10 force damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Jahad fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Stalwart
entries: Jahad has advantage on saving throws if he is aware of the hazard or the point of origin.

trait.name: Fighting Style: Dueling
entries: When Jahad is wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, he gains a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon (included in damage).

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Long Rest)
entries: Jahad can reroll a saving throw that he fails. If he does so, he must use the new roll, and he can't use this feature again until he finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Eldritch Strike
entries: When Jahad hits a creature with a weapon attack, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell he casts before the end of his next turn.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: Jahad has advantage on Constitution saving throws that he makes to maintain concentration on a spell when he takes damage. He can perform somatic components of spells even when he has weapons or a shield in one or both hands. When a hostile creatureâ€™s movement provokes an opportunity attack from him, Jahad can use his reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

trait.name: Cruel Fate (6/Long Rest)
entries: When Jahad makes an attack roll or an ability check and rolls a 9 or lower on the d20, he can manipulate fate and treat the roll as a 10.

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When Jahad makes a melee attack against a creature, he doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether he hit or not.

trait.name: Slasher
entries: Once per turn when Jahad hits a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, he can reduce the speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of his next turn. When Jahad scores a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, he grievously wounds it. Until the start of his next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

trait.name: Runes (7)
entries: Jahad has the following seven runes prepared on his person: {@i Death, Dragon, Fire, Frost, King, Mountain, Storm}

trait.name: Monstrous Presence
entries: Each non-construct creature that sees Jahad for the first time (or the first time in 1 week) must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or see him as a terrible monster that must be slain at all costs. An affected creature must use all its movement (and Dash if necessary) to reach Jahad and attack him with a melee attack. An unaffected creature may use its action to end this effect on an affected creature, and an affected creature may remake the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. A creature that is immune to the Charmed or Frightened conditions is immune to this ability.

trait.name: Action Surge (2/Short Rest)
entries: On his turn, Jahad can take one additional action. He can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see when he uses Action Surge. He can teleport before or after the additional action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Jahad is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The Jahad has the following Wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Jahad makes four melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Jahad
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d8 + 10}) magic slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire, lightning, poison, acid, or cold damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: Jahad enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. He is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Jahad Original: Red {@recharge 6}
entries: Jahad hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point he can see within 120 feet of him. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This is considered a spell that requires only somatic components.

action.name: Jahad Original: Blue {@recharge 6}
entries: Jahad magically creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target he can see within 120 feet of him. A target must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This is considered a spell that requires only somatic components.

action.name: Jahad Original: Green {@recharge 6}
entries: Jahad creates poisonous globs around up to 3 creatures within 30 feet of him that he can see. The targets must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage. This is considered a spell that requires only somatic components.

action.name: Jahad Original: Black {@recharge 6}
entries: Jahad summons ominous clouds that rain acid. Each creature in a 15-foot radius, 10-foot tall cylinder must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be covered in acid for 1 minute or until a creature uses its action to remove the acid from itself or another creature. A creature covered in the acid takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. This is considered a spell that requires only somatic components.

action.name: Jahad Original: White {@recharge 6}
entries: A wave of sheer cold ripples forth from Jahad. Each creature within 30 feet of Jahad must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This is considered a spell that requires only somatic components.

action.name: Action Surge (2/rest)
entries: On his turn, Jahad, The Sword Spirit can take one additional action. He can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see when he uses Action Surge. He can teleport before or after the additional action.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: On his turn, Jahad can regain hit points equal to 25 ({@damage 1d10 + 20}).

bonus.name: War Magic
entries: When Jahad uses his action to cast a spell, he can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Rune Master
entries: Jahad uses a rune he has prepared.

bonus.name: Weapon Bond (2 weapons)
entries: Once he has bonded a weapon to himself, Jahad can't be disarmed of that weapon unless he is {@condition incapacitated}. If it is on the same plane of existence, he can summon that weapon as a bonus action on his turn, causing it to teleport instantly to his hand. Jahad can summon only one weapon at a time with the bonus action.

reaction.name: Bahamut's Boon (6/Long Rest)
entries: Jahad can manifest protective wings that can shield him or others. When Jahad or another creature he can see within 5 feet of him is hit by an attack roll, he can use his reaction to manifest spectral wings from his back for a moment. He grants a bonus to the target's AC equal to his proficiency bonus against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss.

reaction.name: Rune Reaction
entries: Jahad activates a rune in response to being hit or making a saving throw.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Jahad increases his AC by two when defending against a melee or ranged weapon attack.

legendaryHeader: Jahad can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. He regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cleave
entries: Jahad makes an attack against a creature within his reach.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: Jahad casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Gem Step
entries: Jahad taps into the sword's gems and magically teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet of him.

legendary.name: Spellcasting (2 actions)
entries: Jahad casts a spell or uses an original spell that is recharged.

legendary.name: Kneel For Your King (2 actions)
entries: Jahad attempts to hit a creature with a weapon attack roll to frighten that target. The target must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition frightened} of him until the end of his next turn. On a successful save, the target has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Giant Strike (2 actions)
entries: Jahad uses an Awakened ability of his sword, if available.

legendary.name: Behold the King's Might! (3 actions)
entries: Jahad uses an Exalted Form ability of his sword, if available.

legendaryGroup.name: Jahad
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Jahad can take one of the following lair actions; Jahad can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items: Jahad targets a creature within his lair with unfiltered dragon's blood, making a Dexterity attack roll (11 to hit).
Jahad converts dragon blood into pure magic, regaining [3d4+3] health.
Jahad uses dragon blood to scrawl a rune he has expended onto his equipment.
